lead_paragraph: Lisa S. Coico did not overstep her authority when she used money from a fund traditionally earmarked for arts programming to pay adjunct salaries, an internal review has found.

headline.print_headline: City College Used Money Properly, Review Says
headline.main: City College Leader Didn’t Misuse Donation, Review Finds

snippet: Lisa S. Coico did not overstep her authority when she used money from a fund traditionally earmarked for arts programming to pay adjunct salaries, an internal review has found....
abstract: Internal review conducted by City College of New York finds that its president, Lisa S Coico, did not overstep her authority when she used funds from Martin and Toni Sosnoff Fund for the Arts to pay adjunct salaries; senior faculty remain divided on outcome of review, which was triggered after they learned that account that should have held more than $600,000 had only $76.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Sosnoff, Martin and Toni, Fund for the Arts
